reviews.review_msg: I am currently taking ITAL 100 with Professor Vintila and he is one of the best teachers I've had in my life. He truly made me appreciate Italian language at an entirely other level. He is so caring and is always there if you need help. He is always accomodating to his student's needs and engages the whole class in his lectures. 110% recommended.
Such an inspiring professor. Make sure to attend classes to engage and you'll learn very well. A very fun course to take. Italian is not that hard, just need to get used to it.

really terrible. he does not use the course syllabus and I found this out when grades came back. his tests are too long and he takes too long with the listening, like we waste most of the test on it. he should grade on the syllabus that he showed us he needs to reduce his tests length and fix his grading then he would be a 3.5/5.

You teach yourself all the course material from the textbook while Vlad only goes over the questions during lectures. He is not clear on what he's looking for, and gives low grades. Also, he likes to pick on the people who do not understand the language. I left all of the INTRO classes feeling humiliated. BTW, a lot more difficult than it should be

Vlad is a great guy. He is so passionate about the subject and he takes the time to make sure everyone understood what they were doing. If you don't pay attention in class it will be confusing, but that's on you. All tests and quizzes consisted of stuff we went over in class many times. He is very interactive which makes lectures engaging.

Vlad is a great prof. He truly cares for his students' well-being. He even goes out of his way to make students understand course material and feel supported throughout their learning journey. Also, he is very genuine and super knowledgeable! I heard he speaks like five different languages, which makes him even cooler!
